articles.author: Maria Cramer
articles.title: Remains Found on California Mountain Belonged to Manzanar Detainee
articles.description: In 1945, Giichi Matsumura left the infamous Japanese-American internment camp to paint in the Sierra Nevada and never returned.
articles.content:
Giichi and Ito Matsumura had decided to stay.
The Matsumuras, like many families incarcerated during the war, had no home or business to return to and so they continued living in Manzanar, according to the joint statement.
The day Mr. Matsumura left with th… [+1081 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Islamist Group Al Shabaab Attacks Kenya Base Used by Kenyan, U.S. Forces - The New York Times
articles.description: Somalia's Islamist group al Shabaab on Sunday attacked a military base in Lamu county in Kenya that is used by both U.S. and Kenyan forces, a source and al Shabaab said.
articles.content:
NAIROBI Somalia's Islamist group al Shabaab on Sunday attacked a military base in Lamu county in Kenya that is used by both U.S. and Kenyan forces, a source and al Shabaab said.

articles.title: As Fires Rage, Australia Sees Its Leader as Missing in Action
articles.description: The country is venting frustration with Prime Minister Scott Morrison over what many view as a nonchalant response to the disastrous blazes and his unwavering dismissal of climate change.
articles.content:
The government claims it has reduced emissions, Mr. Hare said. What theyre using are essentially accounting tricks to justify or explain their reasoning.

articles.author: Kurt Streeter
articles.title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being Russell Wilson
articles.description: Once derided as a goody-goody, the Seattle Seahawks quarterback has had to be perfect for his team to win this season. Can he keep it up and exorcise a Super Bowl ghost?

articles.title: Congress, Stop President Trump’s Rush to War With Iran
articles.description: Powerful Republican senators are the only people with the power to restrain the president.
